Hi, S�ren.

  S�ren Vejrup Carlsen wrote:
> Dear All.
> I have been monitoring this mailing-list and the activity on the cvs
> repository for the heritrix crawler for a while.
> 
> And today, I have tried building the heritrix crawler on a Linux RH 7.3
> machine
 >
> When I call "bash startbuild.sh build.xml" I get the following errors:

These errors are related to two recent changes:

  (1) To resolve an HTTP hanging problem, we began developing against
      the latest Apache Commons HTTPClient library. However, the
      httpclient jar in our lib/binaries project directory hasn't
      yet been updated. I'll update it today.

  (2) To add to the HTTPClient library perfect byte-level retention
      of HTTP requests and responses, we've created patched versions
      of several of its classes. (The functionality couldn't be easily
      added by subclassing.)

      As you've noticed, these new classes are in the /oversrc (override
      src) directory. Project classpaths should be adjusted to ensure
      the classes in this directory are consulted before the standard
      HTTPClient library. This change hasn't yet been made to the
      official build script. I'll also update it today.

With those two changes, you should get a good build.

Otherwise, over the last few days some reorganization and refactoring
has been occurring (and will be continuing), sometimes leaving the
CVS repository code in a semibroken state, in some cases requiring an
updated "crawl-order" file to supply new necessary configuration.

With only two of us in the same room here at the Archive working on
the code, we've been a bit lax in keeping the CVS complete and consistent.

Knowing you're giving it a try, and also in preparation for our new team
members arriving soon, we'll update things and post a bulletin when
they should be more amenable to tryout.

- Gordon
